message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Confirming 诗意 resolution: "the poetic" / "the Poetic" in glossary">
The author endorses the current resolution for 诗意 (shiyi):

- **"the poetic"** as the standard substantive form
- **"poetic"** as adjective
- **"poeticality"** acceptable as an occasional variant noun
- **Capitalize "the Poetic"** in the translator's introduction and glossary to signal philosophical weight

Does everyone still agree with this resolution? Any second thoughts now that we've been through the full dictionary discussion? Concise yes/no + any brief additions.
</teammate-message>

input.summary: Agree, one note on capitalization scope
input.content: **Yes, still agree.** One small note: capitalize "the Poetic" not only in the glossary and translator's introduction but also on first occurrence in each essay where it appears as a technical term. After that, lowercase "the poetic" in running text. This mirrors the standard convention for Heideggerian terms (e.g., "Being" capitalized when referring to Sein as a philosophical concept, "being" lowercase for Seiendes in running text). It signals to the reader: "this word is doing philosophical work here" without cluttering every subsequent occurrence.

routing.summary: Agree, one note on capitalization scope
routing.content: **Yes, still agree.** One small note: capitalize "the Poetic" not only in the glossary and translator's introduction but also on first occurrence in each essay where it appears as a technical term. After that, lowercase "the poetic" in running text. This mirrors the standard convention for Heideggerian terms (e.g., "Being" capitalized when referring to Sein as a philosophical concept, "being" lowercase for Seiendes in running text). It signals to the reader: "this word is doing philosophical work here" without cluttering every subsequent occurrence.

content.text: Standing by. All my tasks are complete. Ready for further consultation questions as the translation proceeds.
